title: SS.PT.324
prompt: What is the opportunity cost of paying for tuition?
description: Maria is a single mother who is applying for a nursing program at her local community college. She would like to buy a car to travel to and from college, but she can also take the bus. She has $4800 to pay for tuition and a bus pass or to buy a used car. Maria decides to pay for tuition and a bus pass.
feedback: Opportunity cost is defined as the “opportunities” one gives up when making an economic decision. In this case Maria decides to pay for tuition and a bus pass instead of buying a used car. The opportunity cost of choosing college is the used car.
